verses.kjv: And it came to pass after this, that David enquired of the LORD, saying, Shall I go up into any of the cities of Judah? And the LORD said unto him, Go up. And David said, Whither shall I go up? And he said, Unto Hebron.
verses.ct: After this, David asked the LORD, 'Should I move to one of the towns in Judah?' The LORD told him, 'Yes, go.' David asked, 'Which one should I go to?' He answered, 'Hebron.'

verses.kjv: So David went up thither, and his two wives also, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail Nabal’s wife the Carmelite.
verses.ct: So David went there along with his 2 wives, Ahinoam from Jezreel and Abigail, the widow of Nabal from Carmel.

verses.kjv: And his men that were with him did David bring up, every man with his household: and they dwelt in the cities of Hebron.
verses.ct: David also brought all the men who were with him, each with his family, and they settled in the towns around Hebron.

verses.kjv: And the men of Judah came, and there they anointed David king over the house of Judah. And they told David, saying, That the men of Jabeshgilead were they that buried Saul.
verses.ct: Then the people of Judah came and anointed David as king over the tribe of Judah. When David was told that the men of Jabesh-gilead had been the ones who buried Saul,

verses.kjv: And David sent messengers unto the men of Jabeshgilead, and said unto them, Blessed be ye of the LORD, that ye have shewed this kindness unto your lord, even unto Saul, and have buried him.
verses.ct: he sent messengers to them with this message: 'May the LORD bless you for showing such loyalty to your lord Saul by giving him a proper burial.

verses.kjv: And now the LORD shew kindness and truth unto you: and I also will requite you this kindness, because ye have done this thing.
verses.ct: May the LORD now show you faithful kindness, and I will also repay you for what you have done.

verses.kjv: Therefore now let your hands be strengthened, and be ye valiant: for your master Saul is dead, and also the house of Judah have anointed me king over them.
verses.ct: So be strong and courageous. Your master Saul is dead, but the tribe of Judah has anointed me as their king.'

verses.kjv: But Abner the son of Ner, captain of Saul’s host, took Ishbosheth the son of Saul, and brought him over to Mahanaim;
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Abner son of Ner, the commander of Saul's army, had taken Saul's son Ishbosheth and brought him across to Mahanaim.

verses.kjv: And made him king over Gilead, and over the Ashurites, and over Jezreel, and over Ephraim, and over Benjamin, and over all Israel.
verses.ct: There he made him king over Gilead, the Ashurites, Jezreel, Ephraim, Benjamin, and all the rest of Israel.

verses.kjv: Ishbosheth Saul’s son was forty years old when he began to reign over Israel, and reigned two years. But the house of Judah followed David.
verses.ct: Ishbosheth son of Saul was 40 years old when he became king over Israel, and he ruled for 2 years. The tribe of Judah, however, followed David.

verses.kjv: And the time that David was king in Hebron over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.
verses.ct: David ruled as king in Hebron over the tribe of Judah for 7 years and 6 months.

verses.kjv: And Abner the son of Ner, and the servants of Ishbosheth the son of Saul, went out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.
verses.ct: Abner son of Ner and the soldiers of Ishbosheth son of Saul marched out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.

verses.kjv: And Joab the son of Zeruiah, and the servants of David, went out, and met together by the pool of Gibeon: and they sat down, the one on the one side of the pool, and the other on the other side of the pool.
verses.ct: Joab son of Zeruiah and David's soldiers also marched out and met them at the pool of Gibeon. The 2 groups sat down facing each other on opposite sides of the pool.

verses.kjv: And Abner said to Joab, Let the young men now arise, and play before us. And Joab said, Let them arise.
verses.ct: Abner said to Joab, 'Let's have some of the young men get up and fight in a contest in front of us.' Joab replied, 'Agreed, let them do it.'

verses.kjv: Then there arose and went over by number twelve of Benjamin, which pertained to Ishbosheth the son of Saul, and twelve of the servants of David.
verses.ct: So 12 men were chosen from Benjamin's side representing Ishbosheth son of Saul, and 12 from David's soldiers, and they stepped forward.

verses.kjv: And they caught every one his fellow by the head, and thrust his sword in his fellow’s side; so they fell down together: wherefore that place was called Helkathhazzurim, which is in Gibeon.
verses.ct: Each man grabbed his opponent by the head and drove his sword into his opponent's side, and they all fell down dead together. That is why the place in Gibeon was named Helkath-hazzurim.

verses.kjv: And there was a very sore battle that day; and Abner was beaten, and the men of Israel, before the servants of David.
verses.ct: A fierce battle broke out that day, and Abner and the men of Israel were defeated by David's soldiers.

verses.kjv: And there were three sons of Zeruiah there, Joab, and Abishai, and Asahel: and Asahel was as light of foot as a wild roe.
verses.ct: The 3 sons of Zeruiah were there — Joab, Abishai, and Asahel. Asahel was as fast on his feet as a wild gazelle.

verses.kjv: And Asahel pursued after Abner; and in going he turned not to the right hand nor to the left from following Abner.
verses.ct: Asahel chased after Abner, never veering to the right or the left as he pursued him.

verses.kjv: Then Abner looked behind him, and said, Art thou Asahel? And he answered, I am.
verses.ct: Abner looked back and called out, 'Is that you, Asahel?' He answered, 'It is.'

verses.kjv: And Abner said to him, Turn thee aside to thy right hand or to thy left, and lay thee hold on one of the young men, and take thee his armour. But Asahel would not turn aside from following of him.
verses.ct: Abner told him, 'Turn aside — go after one of the younger soldiers and take his equipment.' But Asahel refused to stop chasing him.

verses.kjv: And Abner said again to Asahel, Turn thee aside from following me: wherefore should I smite thee to the ground? how then should I hold up my face to Joab thy brother?
verses.ct: Abner warned Asahel again, 'Stop pursuing me! Why should I have to strike you down? How could I ever look your brother Joab in the eye again?'

verses.kjv: Howbeit he refused to turn aside: wherefore Abner with the hinder end of the spear smote him under the fifth rib, that the spear came out behind him; and he fell down there, and died in the same place: and it came to pass, that as many as came to the place where Asahel fell down and died stood still.
verses.ct: But Asahel refused to turn away. So Abner thrust the butt end of his spear into Asahel's stomach, and the spear went through his back. He collapsed right there and died on the spot. Everyone who reached the place where Asahel had fallen stopped in their tracks.

verses.kjv: Joab also and Abishai pursued after Abner: and the sun went down when they were come to the hill of Ammah, that lieth before Giah by the way of the wilderness of Gibeon.
verses.ct: But Joab and Abishai kept pursuing Abner. By the time the sun was setting, they had reached the hill of Ammah, near Giah on the road to the wilderness of Gibeon.

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin gathered themselves together after Abner, and became one troop, and stood on the top of an hill.
verses.ct: The men of Benjamin rallied behind Abner, forming a single unit, and took a stand on top of a hill.

verses.kjv: Then Abner called to Joab, and said, Shall the sword devour for ever? knowest thou not that it will be bitterness in the latter end? how long shall it be then, ere thou bid the people return from following their brethren?
verses.ct: Abner shouted to Joab, 'Must the killing go on forever? Don't you realize this will only lead to more bitterness? How long before you order your men to stop chasing their own brothers?'

verses.kjv: And Joab said, As God liveth, unless thou hadst spoken, surely then in the morning the people had gone up every one from following his brother.
verses.ct: Joab replied, 'As surely as God lives, if you hadn't spoken up, my men would have kept pursuing their brothers until morning.'

verses.kjv: So Joab blew a trumpet, and all the people stood still, and pursued after Israel no more, neither fought they any more.
verses.ct: Then Joab blew the trumpet, and all his men halted. They stopped pursuing Israel and quit fighting.

verses.kjv: And Abner and his men walked all that night through the plain, and passed over Jordan, and went through all Bithron, and they came to Mahanaim.
verses.ct: Abner and his men marched through the Jordan Valley all night long, crossed the Jordan River, traveled through all of Bithron, and arrived at Mahanaim.

verses.kjv: And Joab returned from following Abner: and when he had gathered all the people together, there lacked of David’s servants nineteen men and Asahel.
verses.ct: When Joab returned from chasing Abner and assembled all his troops, 19 of David's soldiers were missing, plus Asahel.

verses.kjv: But the servants of David had smitten of Benjamin, and of Abner’s men, so that three hundred and threescore men died.
verses.ct: But David's soldiers had killed 360 of Abner's men from Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And they took up Asahel, and buried him in the sepulchre of his father, which was in Bethlehem. And Joab and his men went all night, and they came to Hebron at break of day.
verses.ct: They carried Asahel's body and buried him in his father's tomb in Bethlehem. Then Joab and his men marched through the night and reached Hebron at dawn.
